org.javact.compiler
Class Options

java.lang.Object
  org.javact.compiler.Options

 class Options
extends java.lang.Object

Class that defines the compiler options. The options are defined as static fields which are checked by other classes to know whether a given option is enabled or not.

Version:
0.5.0
Author:
Vincent Hennebert

OPTSUBDIR

static final java.lang.String OPTSUBDIR
Name of the subdirectory option. This is the name that must be given to the compiler to activate the option.

See Also:

SUBDIR

static boolean SUBDIR
true if the generated files must be stored in a subdirectory. Default false. This is checked by other classes when they want to know whether the subdir option has been enabled or not.

OPTLONGVERBOSE

static final java.lang.String OPTLONGVERBOSE
Name of the long verbose option. For compatibilty with the javac compiler. This is the name that must be given to the compiler to activate the option.

Constructor Detail

Options

Options()
Method Detail

parseOptions

static void parseOptions(java.util.Iterator argsIter)
Parses the compilation options. These options are:
–h
–help		 show a help message: compiler and options usage;
–v
–verbose		 verbose. Gives informations about the file being parsed, the roles found, behavior interfaces, etc.;
–b <backup_dir> saves already existing generated files in the given directory, before overwriting them.
Note that it will not search for all generated files, but only those that otherwise would be overwrited by a new generation.
–g <dir>
–generated–dir <dir>		 stores the generated files in the given subdirectory;
–p <package_name> puts generated messages in a package with the given package name.

Parameters:
argsIter - an iterator on the arguments string that was passed to the compiler at its invocation.

usage

static void usage(java.io.PrintStream out)
Display a help message. Usage of all existing options.

Parameters:
out - stream to which the message has to be printed out.
